text: Red fruit aroma, slightly acidic. Great drinkable texture with pleasant fizzling. Tastes really nice. It overflows you with cherries.
Dużo wiśni, przyjemnie kwaśne, lekkie nuty skóry, dobrze się pije i szybko znika.

Very dark purpelish red with almost no head. Intense sour cherry nose with very little sweet fruit, just very mineral and intense. The taste is pretty sour and dry with big sour cherry influence. Mouthfeel is light with a soft fizz. Dry and mineral aftertaste and lingering sour cherry. Good!

Nice pinkish red pour. Beautiful cherry skin notes in the nose, sour and acidic as well. Drinks also considerably sour but fruit is still pronounced and overall balance is right. Cleans my palate and is truly enjoyable.
Hazy purple pink color. Amazing sharp sour nose with intense cherry and oak notes. Very sour sharp mouth, puckering sourness. The cherries are so well presented. Just fantastic
Taster at En Öl och Whiskymässa 2017. dark reddish, no head on this one. Lots of cherries, funky and fruity. Tart, medium mouthfeel, very dry. Wonderful beer from De Cam, they know their thing.
Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle poured into a snifter. Clear red with small pink head. Aroma is tart cherry, medium body, medium carbonation, and thin small-bubble lacing. Taste is rich sharp cherry.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wow.

Dark ruby pour, visibly flat, with a very thin, coarse-grained pink head. Very nice colour. Notes of cherries, cherry cores, horse blanket, barnyard funk, apple vinegar, tart grapes, cherry liquor. Very tart and quite heavy on mineral notes. A bit too flat, like most unblended lambics I have tasted, but delicious nonetheless.

Bottled. Pours hazy red with a tiny pink head. Aroma of cherries, almond, citrus notes, barnyard and more funk. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Kriek indee. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Poured from a 750 ml bottle, vintage unknown but probably 2012 or 2013. Aroma is full of nice cherry aromas with rich, juicy notes. Some medium tannin and skin notes with some light herbal, phenolic notes. Light oak. Pours a deep, dark, purple-red with a small, thin, forced pink head that recedes quickly to the edges where it lingers. No lacing or legs. Flavor is slightly sweet with a moderate acidity that is slightly sharp. Lots of cherry notes, juicy, tannic, and meaty. Some skins and pit notes. Light leafy notes with a touch of an herbal character. Some light earthy and barnyard notes. Light oak. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low to no carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, a nice kriek lambiek. Lots of complex cherry flavor and aroma. Good earthy and herbal notes from the lambic that add a deepness to the cherry notes. This is good, but I have had better bottles of this beer.
Rotte geur, veel koolzuur. Prachtige robijn kleur. Leuke smaak, intens verfrissend met heerlijke zuren van de kersen. Smaakt jong.

Bottle, vintage 2015. Pours clear, dark ruby red, with a small, pink, rocky head. Aroma is funky farmhouse, sour cherries, red wine grapes, tannins and wooden barrels. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is tart, with cherries, musty berries and earthy notes, as well as farmhouse notes, with barrels, tannins and some leather. Lingering dry, earthy finish.

Aroma: Cherry, acid, funk. Appearance: Low head, pinky, leaves lacing, hazy violet body. Taste: Very smooth, quite sour, cherry, lighlty sweet, cherry stones, tannins. Palate: Low carbonation, medium body, tart finish.
Red, no head, aroma of yogurt, banana punch, cherries, mild, brett, flavor of yogurt, banana, cherry, brett, sourish, green tea, fresh, vinous, wood, medium bodied.

Botella @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 04/11/2016. 
Color rojizo, sabor frutal intenso, notas agrias, cuerpo alto,

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Botella 75 cl en el Lupulo 04..11..2016. (r299). Lote A embotellada agosto 2015 hasta 2035. Color rojizo intenso turbio con espuma rojiza. Aromas y sabores no tan ácidos y gaseosos en favor de frutos rojos guiness y cerezas que le dan cierto dulce más de la cuenta. Cuerpo medio a intenso. Sensaciones de licor de guiness. Cerezas maduras y guiness sobretodo al calentar. Cierto amargo final algo seco y afrutado. Bastante buena. Un zumo de cerezas. Para repetir.

Pours a deep purple from the 2016 bottle with minimal ring of bubbly pink head. Aroma of strong acidity, tart cherry fruitiness, and a hint of funk. Taste is funk up front, horsey weird, then a big fruitiness that lends to acidity, but it finishes quickly. Could use a bit more time for refermentation in the bottle, but its really good.

Bottle shared by Huhzubendah. Not sure the vintage. Thanks Matthew! Poured a really dark ruby red color with a small fizzy pink head. Funky, really dusty. Flavor is a ton of cherry. Bitter cherry pits, light Kalamata olive? That part was a bit strange. I dont want to blame the food I was eating, but it might have been that. Really nice!

0,75l bottle at home. Vintage 2016. BB 2036. dark brown color, almost not head. smells nutty, marzipan, wood, cherry notes, wine barrel notes, some berry notes, light green apples, some funk, hints of vinegar. lovely smell. medium to full body, very light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of cherries, some funk, wood, vinegar, nutty. finishes rather sour and quite dry with notes of wood, cherries and vinegar. nice one, very lovely smell, but quite sour / vinegarish, apart form that lacks a bit complexity on the taste. overall still quite nice beer.

DWF; Bottle 750 cl, drunk at Melkebaren. Pours small to moderate, dark red with a shortlived reddish head. Nose is heavy, cherries, sour, almonds, light wood and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and sour with a lasting wood, spice finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Nice!

Pours clear deep red with a tiny head. Aroma of meaty cherries, sweet flowers, rose with some vinous notes as well. Taste is complex fruity, lots of ripe berries, just a very good balance, and a perfect after dinner beer.
Shared bottle at local tasting, fj ØL øy, saturday 2.session..
Shared bottle at RB/HD at Fjøløy 03.09.16. Dark ruby. Fine, pink head. Superb aroma and taste of sour cherries, with hints of pepper. Complex and very, very good. Dry.
750 ml flaske delt på RBHD-treff på Fjøløy. Klar dyp rubinfarget kropp med rosa skum. Nydelig lukt av syrlig kirsebær og treverk. Frisk og myk på en gang med deilig kirsebærsmak.

Shared 750 ml green corked & caged bottle at local tasting. Deep red colour, pink head. Intense aroma of farmhouse, horse blanket and sour cherries, also almonds / marzipan. Moderate carbonation. Medium sour and tart flavour with notes of brettanomyces and sour cherries, hints of almonds.

2009 De Cam Kriek Lambiek paired with a bowl of cherries. Will this be cherry overkill? Let's find out!

This lambic pours a deep mauve, kind of purple brown with a fuzzy pink head they vanished fast. 

The aroma is incredibly aceitic vinegar cherry with some acidity and barrel woodsiness.

The taste is tart, oaky, nutty, cherry, vinegar, some sweetness and acidity with a dry finish. 

The fresh cherry sweetness, cuts through the vinegar by accentuates the acidic nature of the finish. I think I served it a tad too warm so I've got more chilling in the fridge or it may be at an odd moment in it's cella ring evolution.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl bottle. Color is dark red. Thin rose head. Medium sourness, light sweetness. Nice balanced acidity. Aroma is cherries, ripe dark fruits, dark fruits peel, chocolate, wood, herb. Getting better as it warms.
Bottle shared by NickD717, 5/15/16. Pours pinkish. Heavy cherry and acetic aroma and flavor. Really nice heartburn a bottle.

750ml bottle in garden, 5th June 16. Pours dark red, flat. Aroma is full on cherry, even from the open, berry fruit, cellar. Taste is rich tart cherry, berry, summer fruit, slight sour linger, also slight sweet, little to no carbonation, good stuff.

750ml bottle. Pours hazy cherry red with minimal head. The aroma is big cherries, acetic notes, leather, and barnyard. Big cherry flavor, pretty tasty with acetic notes, some sweetness and then a tart finish. Medium body, low carbonation, some biting acidity. Pretty solid.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Tom L. 2009 bottle. Hazy pink red color. Aroma is splendid, barnyard, cherries, berries, green apples, wood, plums. Sour, but restrained, flavors of oak, vanilla, cherries, dark fruits, tart apricots, funk. Medium-bodied, oily mouthfeel. Great.

At a tasting, many thanks, no head, murky dark plum like color, aroma of vinegar and leather with a fruity backbone, flavor is a melange of dark fruits with some funk. Quite mild and subdued but really enjoyable.
Bottle. Aroma is super funky black cherry with mild vinegar and flowers. Tastes mildly sour with some nice funky and jammy black cherries. Mild vinegar too. Love this.

Bottle: The aroma consists of big sour cherries and lemon. Its pours deep reddish-brown with small pinkish head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thick ring. The flavor starts a quick dose of moderate sweet cherry. The finish has mild lemon, funk, spice, and apple. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.
Bottle at tasting. Red pour. Aroma of tart, cherry, grain and horseblanket. Nice tart taste of horseblanket, sour cherry, grain and mild oak. Very nice.
Ruby red color with light foam ring. Fruity nose. Little carbonation with very clear, full and little sweet cherry flavor. Fruity calm aftertaste.
Purple color with small head. Aroma is cherry stone, funk. Taste is leathery, earthy, cherries, nice tartness, tannins in the finish. Good complexity. No carbonation, excellent.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Clearly not an oude kriek but a lambiek. Good cherries, but more fruit and less refreshing than other krieks. Earthy, darker. Almost no carbonation. Nicely balanced, good complexity.

On tap at the brewery. Ruby red colour. Pinkish medium head. Sour at first. Deep, clear, natural cherry taste all the way. Hints of cherry stones. Hints of oakiness. Very well balanced. Light bodied, low carbonated. One of the best krieks that I ever had.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare ft. Lukasmh and Daawi. Pours deep red with a medium pink head. Aroma is vinous, cherries, leathery tannins, funky, vinegar. Taste is funky, jammy sweet cherries, tannic, tart, light lactic.
Pours deep ruby with no head. Cherries and funk nose, taste is sour with slight cherry pie. Medium body, slight acid burn lingers.

Can @ Dangerous Bottleshare featuring Lukas and Aaron. Pours deep ruby red with a pink head. Aroma is very vinous with some deep red wine notes along with some very funky notes. Leather cheese, vanilla, sweet cherry, oak and weak perfume as well. The taste has some cherry, funk lactic notes and is generally a bit weak than the very aroma but still carries some of the same things. Solid stuff!

Bottle shared at home, 2009 label. Very dark Bordeaux red with short lasting red head. Wow, massive cobwebs, cellar, dust up front. Strong funk, hay, diesel oil, earthy. Just massive dry cellar notes of front with actual barnyard mixed in. Than theres some berry skins, almonds and berry pits with some soft sweet cherries underneath. Light sour and bitter. Under medium bodied with very low carbonation. Unusual for a kriek, but very drinkable. Good stuff from De Cam once again, but it could be more fruity.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare featuring Lukas and Aaron. Deep red pour with some pinkish lacings. Notes of cherries, grapes, funk, cheese, barnyard and some sweet vanilla. A tad thin.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares Feat Lukas&Aaron! Juts got this from belgiuminabox.com. Pours a deep ruby red with a pink head. Aroma has cherry, funk, cheese, vinous perfume, oak. Smells great! Taste is pretty nice cherry sour and very oaky and funky dry at first, but unfortunately gets very weak and watery very fast. Ends up as being not so complex. High carbonation and a medium dry, oily body.

(De Cam Kriek Lambiek) Bottle 750 ml, corked and caged, served into a big tulip. ABV 6.5%
Deep ruby red colour on the body, small pinkish head on top mostly consisting of bubbles, good retention.
Lots of cherries on the aroma, some funk, wood.
Great taste, just as sour as it needs, lots of cherries again, wood, funky character.
Medium thin body, nicely carbonated.
Very good.

Bottle, 0.75l, courtesy of Bongtribe, shared with Luka. Pours cloudy ruby color with thin totally diminishing off-white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of sour cherry, red currant, must and wood. Taste starts with tart cherry, follows musty and funky with crisp and dry mouthfeel. Light to medium body, thin texture and average carbonation in palate. Another gem...
Sample at SBWF. Pours crimson with low pink head. Aroma is of cherries, cranberries, wood and funk. Taste is sour with cherries, cranberries, light raspberries, sour funk and wood. Lovely.
Bottled. Red to light bright, low carbo. Aroma of cherry vine, wood, oak. Refreshing dry taste with cherry, oak barrels, yogurt. Elegant lambic with awesome balance.
Bottle at BBF LAb. Dark red colour with reddish head. Barnyard aroma and taste, slightly sweet. Medium body.

From my backlogg: 

Bottle 2014. Murky red beer with a small white head. Sourish fruity a bit nutty aroma. Fruity sweetish cherry, nutty flavour.

Bottle 750ml @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours hazy red/purple with a small pink head. Aroma has notes of malt, barnyard, funk, brett and cherry. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium sour with a long tart, dry, cherry, funky and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft. Very nice and dry kriek.

Bottle at bar shared with Meilby. Pours a very nice red with a slight pink head. Aromas of light cherries, champagne and purple grapes. Tastes sour and sweet, medium to full body, lively carbonation. Good, but Im still getting used to how a balanced sour beer should be interpreted.
Sample @ En Öl & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg 25/4-15. Fruity with cherries, also bretty and acidic with some cinnamon. Bone dry finish with cherries and cinnamon.

Bottle shared. Rudby red color with no head at all. Nose is fresh tart cherries but gets disturbed by a burnt ruber note that really bothers me. Flavour is a simple light tartness, red berries, jam, bit of apple peel. Very low carb and super easy to drink.

750ml bottle shared with ippopotamo36 @La Tana. Amazing cherry-ruby appearance with a decent pinkish head. Aroma is fresh cherries, barnyard, citric notes. Flavour is medium sour, cherries, quite persistent with some sugar traces. Medium body, almost flat. Decent

Bottle at La Tana pub in Rome - Italy, thank you mortlach for sharing it with me. Pours completely cloudy red going dark, almost purple. Medium off-white pinkish head with gassy orientation. Nose: subtle stable note (very gentle), raspberries, red fruit. Mouth: soft carbonation with a thin sparkling background, medium sourness, strawberries-cherries juicy notes. Very soft and so nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at De Cam & sampled at Volkscafé De Cam. Very big difference between the two versions I tried within the hour of eachother. The one at the Volkscafé was too sweet, almost siruppy. While the one at De Cam was just perfect, Id drink this anyday.
In bottiglia ZBF 15. Aroma intenso di ciliegia che domina lolfatto. al palato piuttosto acida, scorre veloce per lassenza di gasatura. Molto presente laroma di ciliegia, intenso e pulito.
Sample @ En Öl & Whiskymässa 150425. Lots of cherries with bretty notes, acidic, light to medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry with lots of cherries.

Tap at Zythos Beer Festival 2015, Leuven - BE. Color: very intensive dark bordeau cherry beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: high cherry attack with good sweet nose. Finish as fresh almond. Taste: very nice palate sensation. Good sour taste and good sweet cherry finish. Very intensive cherry with dry sensation. Aftertaste: sour finish and dry sensation.
Very cherryish and fresh aroma, like lemonade. Taste very sour. In a way like a wine.
Dark ruby with no head. Sour cherry aroma, sour taste with strong cherry presence, dry sour aftertaste.

Bottle bought at Geers Oostakker last year.
Deep red color with no head.
The aroma of the cherries is strongly present, with a dry and medium sour hint.

April 4, 2015. Bottle, bottled january 2009 (if its not an old label...)
Hazy ruby red with a small pink head. Aroma is tart cherries, yoghurt, almond, light barnyard and slight vinegar. Taste is tart cherries, citrus, light sweet, dry oak and some funky barnyard notes. Dry oaky and fruity finish. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation.

Bottle thanks to _angst_ - shared among friends. 2009 Vintage. Pours mostly clear ruby purple, small pink head, dissipates quickly, some lacing. Aroma is funky, a bit of mushroom and basement. Flavor is dry, medium funk, cherries and brett mixing nicely. Light body, low carbonation. Nice.
Fragrant like a bouquet of flowers. Cherry comes through in the flavor, dry, not terribly tart or funky. Very drinkable but lacks a standout quality.

From old notes.
Bottle @ Akkurat. Zwanze, 14 sept 2013. Had the label of another De Cam beer. Cant remember which.
App: Clear, dark deep red, short pinkish head.
Aroma: Lots of almonds, fresh cherries, stalk, hints of apples, some funk.
Taste: Fruity cherries, some lemon, tart apples, stalk, wood, some funk.
Palate: Medium to bigger body with soft mushy carbonation, dry and a bit woody texture. A bit vinous (?).
Overall: Nice dry fruity kriek with nice carbonation and lots of almonds in the aroma. Someone commented that its a bit short flavourwise, and Im ready to comply. Damn good though.

Sample from bottle at Uppsala Beer 2015. Pinkish red color with pink head. Aroma is tart, fruit, musty cherry notes and vinegar. Taste is tart and lactic, some vinegar, sour cherries and lots of funk. Complex

2009 bottle (though hard to actually know the date, as most bottles of this has 2009 as year listed). No head, a burgundy beautiful color. Aroma slight vinegar, loads of fruit, cherries, raspberries and citrus, slight sweetish hint in the back and some obligatory hay and barnyard. Taste is fairly tart, with the interesting fruity berry taste found in the nose, ends dry with an oak tone. Medium body, soft close to zero carbo. Beautiful.

Bottled in 2009. Pours burgundy red! Promising.. Aroma is full on cherry and almond finish. Hardly any co2 whatsoever. Soft, full tastes, pretty sirupy, dimmed sour, red fruits, wet oak and again almondmilk sweets. Slight tart funk in the after, but rather toned down. Dry finish with lingering cherry. What a lovely lambic with such generous fruityness! Unique!

Pours lught burgundy no head
Aromas of raspberries, cherries, water melons
Taste is intensely sour of grapes, cherries, raspberries. This is extreme, cool, and muthafuckin sour!!!

Pours M U R K Y raspberry burgundy with no head. Looks like blueberry soup... Aroma of raspberries, sweet cherry, almond icing, vinegar, bretta. Taste is huge sour cherry tart, light bicarbonate finish. Body is light and crispy with soft to average carbonation. Very weird and unique.

Pours hazy burgundy with no head. Aromas of cherries, raspberries, vinegar, citrus, funk. Taste is cherries, funk, raspberries, citrus, vinegar. Mouthfeel is dry and very tart with medium carbonation.
Awesome Kriek. Pours ruby red with low carb. Aroma is lambic funk, dusty basement, jammy cherries, and wet oak. Taste is heavy tartness and light fruity sweetness with solid wet wood funk. I dig it.

750, brought back from belgium. Yup awesome, tons of cherry flavors, tart, funcky, barnyard, horseblanket. Whatever you beer geeks call gueuze flavors is that, it tastes like a good gueuze. Descriptive enough for ya?
Bue en bouteille. Belle couleur rosée, nez incroyable sur la cerise et les fruits rouges. Acidité forte en bouche.

Bottle shared at the RBESG 2014, grand tasting 09/08/2014 Moncada Brewery. Lovely pink / purple coloured pour with a small pink head. Aroma is tart fruit, rubber, musty and a splash of vinegar. Flavour is tart fruit, vinegar, sharp acid and horse funk. Palate is tart, drying tanin. Super dry finish. Lingering grassy note with tart cherry.

Bottle. Pours a clear pink beer without any head on top. Aroma has Brett, oak, red fruits. Flavor is very dry, fruity, light sour and loads of oak in there. Has a dry finish, low carbonation and a great balance.

Has no head at all, cloudy, with a very saturated burgundy color.

Nose is full of sunbathed, joung cherries, just before they turn ripe, with only hints of acidity.

Lower carbonation brings out the fruit very well, without adding distracting metallic hints. Begins with sour, unripe cherries, tickeling the tip of the tongue, supported by a leathery tartness, helping to put the fruits even more into the spotlight. The sourness enhances while the beer warms up, resulting in an uncomprimising tartness, in which cherry notes shine through at a later stage, after the palate has been adjusted to the acidity. Gets a little sweeter in the end, adding a lovely complexity to the fruit, the cherries seem to mature during the drinking process.

Small sample from bottle at Camping Ratebeer 14. Pours hazy dark red with almost no head. Aroma is a bit sweet with cherries, a little bit of tartness and red fruits. Taste is medium sour with some sweetness, cherries and a dry finish. Light body, medium carbo. Nice stuff.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl au Sherwood Pub (Nicorvo), couleur rubis, mousse et effervescence moyenne, goût boisé et cerise très marqué ble équilibre avec une acidité très eu présente. Un délice
Bottle date 2009. Ruby red, evaporating white head. Nose. Cherries, sugar, sweet. Taste. Cherry sour. Very sour, kick in the ass. Even 2009,still tastes very young and fresh. Nice Kriek.

Reddish color with a minimal off-white head that quickly diminishes. Aroma with notes of cherries with acidic sensation. Flavor is strong acidic, fruity notes dominating cherries and some citrus. Very acidic final with a good presence on the mouth. Very enjoyable.

Cask @ DeCam Volkscafé. 
De couleur acajou profond trouble, col blanc/ léger.
Arôme cerise fermenté, qcq tanins côté fruité noir qui ressort parfaitement pour mettre toute la complexité de la griotte en avant. On note ci et là un rétro nasal augurant le lambic avec une pointe aigrelette perçant légèrement.

Palais fruité bien cerise sur note lambic. Boisé léger pointe résiduelle fruitée voire douce. Alternance et mariage parfait entre le côté suret et le fruité de la griotte. Le tout est léger avec un fruité qui est mis en avant dune belle manière. Pourra sembler être trop douce pour certain mais pour moi, cest juste idéal.

Bottle drank during RBESG; cloudy red/purple pour with a thin pink head, intense cherry aroma, taste has tart cherries, some acidity and sourness, very enjoyable, could have drank the whole bottle excellent stuff.

The flat, unblended De Cam cherry lambic, so not the same as De Cam Oude Kriek; tasted from tap at De Cam itself but also from bottles available since 2005. Lilac foam, wafer-thin, disappearing immediately and only attainable by force. Dark purplish red wine colour, misty. Aroma richly drenched in fresh, genuine sour cherries, some hints of elderberry, blueberry, lemon, hay, sweat; sharp citric acid in the mouth, very lively, loads of real fruit, lambic becoming more and more prominent as the liquid moves towards the throat, lemony and woody, with a bitter tail. As refreshing and authentic from bottle as from tap.
Bottle. Hazy red, small off white head. Cherries, juicy, wooden, acidic. Medium body, medium sweet and sour, medium carbonation.
Bottle - Sweet and tart cherry. Solid maroon with no head. Slight balsamic and cherry. Really well done, good balance between tart and sour.

Bottle from Dranken Geers in Belgium. Fruity and funky smell. Sour taste, fruity and salty. De cam has a tartness that differs from other beers of the same type and that Im not sure how to describe. Maybe this was a bit too funky.

Bottle at home (2009 bottling). Aroma of sour cherry with a hint of mint and oak. Beautiful clear (at first), ruby-red colour. Dry, woody, wonderfully sour cherry flavours. This bottle is even better than the draught version that I had at De Cam in April. A fantastic cherry lambic!
Awesomely huge gusher! Reddish pink with a light pink head. Aroma is cherry, sour fruit. Medium bodied, fruity and sour on the palate. Taste is cherry, sour cherry candy, funk. Yum
Mooie roodpaarse kleur met een matige kraag. Ruikt fruitig, kers en iets zoetig. Smaakt fris, fruitig, cassis.

Bottled @ Camping Ratebeers 2014, small sample. Slight hazy reddish pink color. Lovely aroma of cherry, cherry pits, hint of marzipan, slight olive? Medium sour taste, slight fruity sweetness. Wonderful kriek.
Bottle @ camping ratebeer 2014. Ruby colour with no head. Smells mint, cherry, dusty, sour, nice. Tastes fresh, fruity, cherry, mint. Medium body, soft carbo. Nice!
Pours a red beer with no head. Smells cherry, framboise, little sour. Tastes sour, cherry. Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.
(Backlog) at spontaneous fermentation. Looks like a pour of merlot. Artificial sweeteners, full cherry, hint of plastic aromas. Moderately tart cherry flavors, nicer than aroma.

Bottle cracked by Rich. Poured red with a slightly pink tinted white head. Notes are cinnamon, cherries, oak, grape skin and funk. Lots of cinnamon cherry flavors but balanced well with some nice sourness. Minimal barn in this medium bodied unblended lambic. Nice.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 Bottle at Ryans. Pours a bright pinkish red body with white lacing. Aroma is cherry, indoor swimming pool and and fruity funk. Mouthfeel is tart with notes of cherry, funky character, tart vinegar and funky fruit. Great.
shared bottle. gusher! bottled 2009. poured dark red with a not to long lasting pink head. a ton of cherries in the aroma! earth, acid, grapes, cinnamon, oak, exellent kriek!

Bottle from Systembolaget. (bottled in 2009)

Hazy reddish with a minimal head. Nicely sour with cherries, wood and funk. Refreshing and easy to drink. I could drink this every week.

13cl sampler at Volkscafé De Cam, pre NvdGD 2014. Pours a gentle ruby-tainted raspberry, not too sure about initial head (soft lacework) or carbo: must be those cuteish sampler mini-mugs. Contained aromas of faint cherry balsamico, raspberry again, older wood mould and dust, not overly expressive. Taste is again hinting more towards mitigated raspberry juice up to the point where I started to wonder whether service mistook the Framboise for the Kriek Lambiek (quod not), "poepegaatjes"/childrenscherry candy without the sticky sugars. Quick finish with some prickly tartness.

Bottle... darkguardians & biggsbowlers West Palm Beach Birthday Bash!... Clear, deep ruby pour with a mid-sized, creamy, white head. Terrific retention. The nose offers the sour funkiness of old, sweaty socks. Medium to full-bodied with airy carbonation. Sour and sweet cherries and caramel malt bow to heavy, puckering acidity in the flavor. Finishes tart with a dash of parmesan cheese funk. Bottle courtesy of darkguardian!
Overall: Balanced, fruity, bretty, nice.Note: Bottle 750 ml at a De Klomp tasting. (Vintage 2009) Reviewed 2014-04-12.

Flaska från systembolaget via privatimportören Constant Companion. Lätt oxiderad, stram, frisk, syrlig med mycket syrlig körsbär/moreller, men också en lite köttig saftig körsbärsmak mer åt bigarå. Riktigt fin.
Ölföreningen. Smak och doft av körsbär, röda bär, röda vinbär. Torr, liten sötma. Fin smakupplevelse.
Funky, footy aroma. A bit of cherry flavor, with a moderate amount of lactic sourness. Slightly thin finish, strangely lacking.
Flaska på nyårsafton. Tylig körsbär i doft. Nötig och intensiva körsbär. Smaken är något tunn och spretig men annars riktigt härlig och massiv körsbärston. Medelsträv.
Bottle. Beetroot purple with pink head. Musty funky aroma, quite medicinal, not particularly pleasant smelling. Tastr is a bit cleaner, medicinal, cherry. Not overly sour. Ok

Pours as a huge gusher with a bright deep cherry color and big pink bubbly foamy head. The aroma brings pure cherries, sweet and tart blended so pleasantly in the nose with big wild yeast note after settling in the glass. The flavor brings cherries, not overly tart at all though, or sweet. It is a subtle balance of both sweet and tart with cherry pie essence settling and lingering nicely on the palate.

Bottle at Tony/Jim BA Birthday Extravaganza 2013 (Western Springs, IL). Pours a well hazed dark reddish ruby hue, crimson cherry juice, a bit dulled and hazed. One of the best I has so far.

My Bottom Line :  
Boastful sour cherries create pie-like impressions on this lambiks brettanomyces notes and highly carbonated moutfeel.

-A slice of foam sits atop the dark red.
-Acidity levels are relatively light compared to the rest of De Cams lineup (or, at least what I know of it).

A steady pour into my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip produces a one finger thick, pale red tinged, full tan colored head. The beer is a dark, concentrated, deep red, plum color. The nose smells fruity, with a note that reminds me of cherry flavored, children aspirin, lots of cherry skin character, sweet concord grape candy, as well as floral sour cherry notes (carnations and a bit of rose), as well as a bit of fruity cherry pulp. The cherry character really dominates the nose, even after the beer warms up.

The beer has a light prickly carbonation, a tannic, astringent texture, to go along with a light body that has enough texture to it that it isnt anywhere near watery. This has a really floral cherry character (it makes me wonder if these use Polish Sour cherries), lots of carnation notes, some light perfume-like rose notes, a tart cherry character that lingers on the palate; in the long finish the beer is has an astringent cherry skin character, but up front there is a really juicy, ripe cherry character that can be a bit confusing as the beer is quite dry and tart up front. There is a medicinal note to the finish, a definite phenolic note, a lingering mustiness and a light funkiness to this beer.

I like that this has a persistent carbonation to it, it definitely helps to make this beer quite a bit more expressive. I really like the floral edge that the cherries bring to this beer. While the cherry character is dominant, the floral edge sort of accentuates the funkiness of the base beer, and the balance between cherries and Lambic really strikes a good balance.

75cl bottle. 2009 vintage. Pours like a gorgeous red wine, deep ruby red with no head at all. Just a ring of bubbles from the vigorous pour. Aroma is cherris, dust and leather. Tons of cherries and little tartness. Taste is again a flood of tart cherries, with little sweetness and just a tad of acidity to speak of. Body is definitely thin and theres no real carbonation to speak of, matbe just a little crisp, but minimally. This is definitely a nice one to try, and is quite different from the usual kriek. O: I love that De Cam bottles their kriek lambiek, its a different experience than the typical kriek and worth seeking out.

38 cl bottle @ Delirium Café, Brussels. Rated on 20.07.2010
Aroma is sour with cherries and earthy notes. Flavour has really stinging sourness and it is a bit tart too. It has berry juice -like cherry aroma and some earthy notes. Good, but the berry juice feeling disturbs a bit.

Cherry juice red colour. Aroma very strongly of cherries, more like amarena cherry than tart krieken. Some marzipan, some slight malts. Flavour sweet cherry, some tart background tones, very fruity. In short: A fantastic kriek, moderately sharp and full of fresh cherries.  Wow!
How: Draft at the De Cam Volkscafe
The look: Beautiful clear dark red body topped by a small persistent pink head
In long: Nose of fresh cherries and barnyard.  Taste is intensely cherry.  This cherry lambic packs as much cherry flavor as a New Glarus Belgian Red.  And with the funk, dryness and acidity of the lambic you get one hell of a fantastic beer.  With such a great Kriek Lambik it is not wonder that De Cam Oud Kriek is also a favorite of mine.  Most draught unassembled lambics are much smoother than an assembled Gueuze/Kriek/etc.  But somehow De Cam base lambics are very intense.  I dont know why that is since he doesnt make his own lambics.  Very soft carbonation (normal for the style).  They sell this awesome beer for 2.30 Euro at De Cam Volkscafe.  I repeat 2.30 Euro!!! (right now about $3).  No kidding.  Is there a better way to spend $3 that doesnt involve an underage Thai prostitute in Bangkok?  I think not.

Bottle (375ml).  At MesandSims, London May 10 2009).  Deep murky ruby pour with a small head. Every single thing you want is here in abundance. Syrupy texture is just sublime, as is the dry tangy finish. A stunning kriekenlambic. On top of it all, it was not meant to be on sale and Karel being a star sent me away with three bottles. Genius.

Bloody, with tart cherries and some tomato acidity. Quite a sour mouthfeel, yet it remains quite soft. Very good balance, with beautiful tart fruit. Sourness is still ever present.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2007 bottle with the two guys below. beautiful dark red color. lots and lots of cherrys. thick and soft. round and pleasant. "best lambic ever".
Bottle at Bager (Thanks to Jacob). Murkey dark red - no head. Lots of cherrys, very nice, the sourness is fine and not overwhelming - very soft !!
Bottled. Ruby red coloured with a small fizzy head. Woaw! Cherries, cherries and more cherries. Yum. Notes of oak and citrus.

Tap at Bruxellensis. Very nice color, very clear with a light pink head. Much sweeter then I was expecting with just the lightest sourness in the finish. Didnt quite have the farmy/wild yesty character as much as others, but still had a nice dryness to the finish.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2009 Bottle (10-05). Rating #3333. Ruby red color, cloudy. Abundant aroma of cherries, cherry pits and oak. Sour flavor compensated by rest sweetness of fresh cherries. Vanilla and oak. Dry out effect in the short aftertaste. Very fruity, but also with complexity. A really lovely young kriek. 

@ RBESG Grand Tasting 2009: 2005 version. Has aged perfectly. Jammy with cherry pits and almond. Absolutely delicious.

Blood-red colored, no head. Cherries, bubble gum and nicely balanced sourness in rich aroma. Flavor is even better: sweet cherries together with strong sourness, very enjoyable and balanced. Medium bodied, fuller than some krieks Ive had before.

Bottle 09/2005 from Dorstvlegel, Antwerp.  Raspberry red colour, no head.  Mulberry red actually.  Farmyard sour with some cherry.  Full in mouth, juicy cherry fruit and raspberry too.  Quite pippy.  Farmyard aroma is rather good.  Vinous aroma.  Some raspberry ripple vanilla in mouth.  Finish has cherry, raspberry, pippy sourness.  Good length.  As good as Boon Kriek?  No, but still a good kriek with great integrated fruit.

(Bottled, 0.375l) Opaque, light red wine color with practically no head. Very berryish aroma of slightly sour cherries and hints of anchovies. Very distinctive, very natural, unsweetened cherry flavor - so far the most natural in any kriek Ive had! Medium-bodied, medium-tart palate with very low carbonation. A truly beautiful, easily drinkable and enjoyable kriek!

An unclear dark red beer with a very thin red head. The aroma is strong and totally dominated by cherries, while the flavor has a nice sharp acidity which blends really well with the strong cherry notes.

Draught. Bloody red-maroon body with a small bubbly pinkish head. Juicy cherries in the aroma along with brett funk, earth, and tear inducing tartness. So far a very nice impression! The body is pretty soft but there is a lot of fruit flavour substance. Quite dry, very sweaty, and complex.

Sampled at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation on May 28, 2006.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2012 Draft pour
Consumed at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation, Opstal, May 2006 Intensely sweet, fruity and fresh natural cherry scented nose.  Amazingly rich cherries, sweet, fresh tasting everywhere.  Sourness is mundane, normal, but still has a nice raw grain component.  Very interesting kriekenlambic, better than most I have tried, though still not exceptional.

37.5 cl bottle. Extreme cherry red, slightly purple colour, practically no head. Powerful oak and sour cherry aroma with hints of almonds. Sour cherry and lemony flavours developing towards a dry, almondy and woody finish. Long aftertaste. Very complex- a great beer.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2006 Draught at Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2006  Unclear raspberry red; Lots of hazelnut, a bit 1-dimensional, orange peel oil, very little cherry; Amazing balance, perfect amount of sourness mixed with a little sweetness, it actually touches all elements nicely, soft textured; Into very long finish, slowing of sourness, aroma continues long with lots of fruit. Great! - - - - - (Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm 27 April) - 9-3-7-3-15 - Beautiful unclear raspberry colored body, huge white head; Very special fresh nose lot of cherry, but just as much pear, depth and complexity, with very nice almond notes, from the cherry pit hidden behind; Little watery, but well balanced body to the sour side; Quite long finish, not all that sour and not as complex as nose, mostly tones of different parts of the cherry.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm 28 Apr) Colour is deep red, hazy, with bubbly head. Nose is very complex, with a harsh cherry character, bitter almond hints from the stones and a cellary tone, a bit like wet leaves in autumn. Taste is fruity and harsch, dominated by cherries. Very dry, acidic, complex and harsh finish. Lovely!
Bottled. Red coloured. Reddish head. Quite acidic cherry taste with notes of sweetness. The beer is extremely pleasant and very natural. This is one of the best fruts Ive tried.

Draft. Ruby colored body with a small pink head. Nose is black cherries, leather, barnyard, litterbox, and wood. Taste is sour cherry, barnyard, leathery hints, and mild wood. Body is light, sour and acidic. Nice dryness to this as well. Finishes with lots of black cherry, mild leather, lemon juice and light earthiness. Very nice!
Draught at De Cam. Dark  red colour with no head. Sweet cherry pits and cherries in the aroma. Fruity cherry flavor with some hints from the cherry pits, also some sourness. Long nutty aftertaste.

Draught @ Grote Dorst 2006: Red cherry colour. Unclear. No head. Cherrydense sweetness in the nose. Some vague tartness. Flaovur is sweet and cherryish but is wellbalanced by some sourness. Great mouthfeel. Is fruity in the end. Good one.

37.5 cl bottle, bottled in September 2005. Appearance of cherry juice: striking red, relatively viscous, almost perfectly clear, almost perfectly headless. Strong smell of sour cherries, almost like in a candy, with an oily etheric and dry woody background. Pretty natural cherry juice flavour, sour of course, little sweetness. A woody background again. Fruity aftertaste. Strong body, mouth-filling, viscous, an almost oily mouthfeel leaving a dry, frictive feeling on the tongue.

Pours deep red with no head. Sweet and sour cherry aroma with faint woody notes, nice and full. Lots of cherry in the dominating sour flavor with a sweet middle. Notes of grapefruit. Fresh and clean in the taste. Good one!
Bottled. Dark red colour, minor head. Sour cherry aroma, sour dry cherry in flavour. Kind of bitter sweetish balanced, but finish is clearly kickass sourish.

Bottled
Deep red cherry colour, not much head. Sour, fruity, dry nose. Smooth, sour, earthy, juicy with good kriek flavor. Not so sour as eg. Cantillons but pleasant and balanced kriek.

Tap, ZBF 2005. Hazy red, fluffy lasting cherry head and low condition. Big gunpowder almond explosion of aroma from the cherry stones, some sweet cherry notes. Superbly balanced sweet and sour cherry lambic and nutty cherry stones in the mouth. Long lingering dry almond finish with some sweet cherries and a pucker of cherry skins. Wish Id saved this one till last as everything else seemed tame in comparison. World class.
Cloudy blood red. Mild fresh cherry aroma. Big juicy cherry flavour, with a tart sour finish. Medium bodied. Nice stuff!
Cloudy dark red appearance. No head. Acidic aroma lemon-peels and hay with deep undertones of black cherries. Big, natural cherry flavour with a nice acidity from citric fruit. Dry aftertaste.
Bottled. Hazily deep red. Fresh cherry aroma. Citric, intense and fruity with a hibnt of barnyard. Classy and elegant, with pleasantly biting acidity.
Sweet cherry aroma. Deep red colour, nice pink head. Distinct cherry flavour with some acidity.
Zythos Beer Festival, Sint-Niklaas, Belgium 2005. Red colour with a big pink head. Sweet sour cherry aroma and a sweet light sour sparkeling cherry taste. Medium body and a sweet finish.

Draught at ZBF 2005. Pours Deep red with a pink frothy head. Aroma is intense sour cherries, with notes of almonds and oak. Taste is of cherries, oak, and a somewhat nutty marcipan like component. After taste is of sour cherries. This lambic was a very good experience

Draught  Fluffy cyclamen head; fully opaque purplish-granate colour. Thick sour cherry nose, almondy touch from the kernels, very faint leathergrease, and faraway lemon. "Thick, juicy, fully ripe sour cherries, somehow enhanced". That is the only way to describe this. Its like a culinary, drinkable orgasm. Extremely full-chewy, like biting is some magically changed fruit. An absolute  topper in fruit beers. If only somebody with enough money could advertise this to the young generation as "  cool  "...

This lambic has a deep red body.  And because of the lac of any head, you could give this-one to a wine-connaisseur and he would think you gave him some kind of Bordeaux-wine (the idiot :))  Nose of sweet cherries and smoke.  Moderately sweet, lightly acidic initial flavour, which is very fruity (cherries), although not (too) sweet.
